posts.post_content: Ugh....you guys.....he's not card disadvantage if they shoot him down. It's a 1-for-1. HE makes the tokens, so if they Doom Blade him, you lose 1 card and they lose 1 card. Not a 3-for-1. He's a very solid card which can end games quickly and is pretty potent when paired with stuff like Vines of Vastwood, Withstand Death, or even Asceticism.

posts.post_content: [Rite of Replication](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rite of Replication) needs to target a golem already on the field and would be copied to hit the other two golems. So, kicked, you get 10 golem tokens from the 2 original copies of the golems and 5 copies of the main card which would then each produce two tokens adding 15 more golems giving you a total of 28 golems (25 Replicated copies and the original 3). **Assuming they survive the a turn and get to attack**, and you have no other creatures, a Might of the Mas$es would add 784 (+28/+28 to 28 different creatures) damage to their base 84 power (28 3/3 creatures) giving you a total of *868* damage.
posts.html:
Rite of Replication needs to target a golem already on the field and would be copied to hit the other two golems. So, kicked, you get 10 golem tokens from the 2 original copies of the golems and 5 copies of the main card which would then each produce two tokens adding 15 more golems giving you a total of 28 golems (25 Replicated copies and the original 3). Assuming they survive the a turn and get to attack, and you have no other creatures, a Might of the Mas$es would add 784 (+28/+28 to 28 different creatures) damage to their base 84 power (28 3/3 creatures) giving you a total of 868 damage.

posts.post_content:
I can't adequately state how much I love this card.   
  
Mtg has always been about how your deck works as a whole. I love how this card has so much potential, depending on what deck you throw him in and can become so devastating in so many different ways. I hope this is a *precursor* to more cards with a wide number of uses depending on how you build a deck with them.  
  
I can think of different ways to use him for every color and most color combos, and can't wait to using this guy in a number of different ways.

posts.post_content:
Argh, I've had such mixed luck with this card. Seems like half the games I run my opponent over with nine power, and half the games something... unpleasant happens.   
  
Once I had it [Slice In Twain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Slice In Twain)'d; lost that game pretty badly. Another time it fell to [Flesh Allergy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flesh Allergy); losing 6 life in addition to my golems wasn't particularly fun. My worst experience was in a cube draft, where my opponent kicked [Into the Roil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Into the Roil) on it. I cast it again, and he stole all my golems with [Ray of Command](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ray of Command) and beat me to death.  
  
This guy is pretty much the definition of "high risk, high reward". Plenty of good combos for you--watch for the ones that go badly.

posts.post_content:
Any cantrip that targets it gives you three cards.  
  
Tainted Strike allows it to end the game in one fell swoop.  
  
This creature is a huge risk, but it could be very well broken with the right deck.  
  
ALSO: Searing blaze doesn't triple itself, since doesn't just target one golem.

posts.post_content: This does not die to Searing Blaze, since Searing Blaze targets the player first and then the creature. It fails in this way for the same reason that if you kill the creature Searing Blaze is targeting then it still deals damage to the player.
posts.html:
This does not die to Searing Blaze, since Searing Blaze targets the player first and then the creature. It fails in this way for the same reason that if you kill the creature Searing Blaze is targeting then it still deals damage to the player.

posts.post_content: This guy really makes that [Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas) final ability really sting. If you get Tezz out a turn early and get him out a turn early when you -4 it adds another 6 damage for 5 colorless. I use a bunch of 0 casting cost artifacts like Ornithopter and [Memnite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Memnite) [Mox Opal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mox Opal) so by turn 4 you can do serious damage when this Golem hits the ground. I also like to use the [Twisted Image](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Twisted Image) to draw three cards for a U. That is sweet.

posts.post_content:
Holy crap, I didn't realize how synergistic this guy was with [Rite of Replication](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rite of Replication). So in total, the Rite makes a copy of precursor and a copy of each of your other golems. The copy of precursor makes tokens.  
???  
Much profit.  
  
Alternatively, you could use [Venser the Sojourner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Venser the Sojourner) to keep blinking Precusor to make additional tokens a la [Grave Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grave Titan).

posts.post_content:
How would this guy interact with [Hive Mind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hive Mind)?  
  
Example: you get out your Precursor Golem and you have [Hive Mind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hive Mind) in play also. Opponent hits Golem with a Lightning Bolt, Doom Blade, whatever. Do you, the controller of the Golem, get 3 copies of opponent's spell or just 1?  
  
Also, it looks like [Hive Mind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hive Mind) would allow you to pick new targets for the copied spells, they wouldn't have to target the Golems again. Am I correct on this?

Posted By: yesnomu (3/15/2011 11:04:24 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Target your own with [Arc Trail](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arc Trail) to potentially burn your opponents for 6, or kill any threatening creatures. Also works well with [Spawning Breath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spawning Breath), pretty much makes it [Brood Birthing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brood Birthing) at instant speed. As others have mentioned, [Twisted Image](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Twisted Image) works, so does [Shape Anew](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shape Anew). [Irresistible Prey](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Irresistible Prey) results in a green Ancestral Recall (albeit at sorcery speed, but still). [Repel the Darkness](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Repel the Darkness) can be used to for the card draw and to tap three of your opponents creatures (play it at the end of their turn). Personally, I enjoy the potential combos with it and look forward to using with Shape Anew....also [Titan Forge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Titan Forge) for even more shenanigans (and potential card disadvantage)
posts.html:
Target your own with Arc Trail to potentially burn your opponents for 6, or kill any threatening creatures. Also works well with Spawning Breath, pretty much makes it Brood Birthing at instant speed. As others have mentioned, Twisted Image works, so does Shape Anew. Irresistible Prey results in a green Ancestral Recall (albeit at sorcery speed, but still). Repel the Darkness can be used to for the card draw and to tap three of your opponents creatures (play it at the end of their turn). Personally, I enjoy the potential combos with it and look forward to using with Shape Anew....also Titan Forge for even more shenanigans (and potential card disadvantage)
